meanings.definition: Past tense of bare: to uncover or expose
meanings.sent1: She bared her soul to her best friend.
meanings.sent2: The detective bared the truth during the interrogation.
meanings.sent3: The magician bared his tricks, revealing how he performed the illusions.
meanings.sent4: The storm bared the tree branches, leaving them exposed to the harsh winds.
meanings.sent5: The artist bared the canvas, ready to create a masterpiece.

meanings.sent1: The model walked confidently down the runway, bared for all to see.

meanings.sent3: The secret was bared, causing a wave of laughter among the group.

meanings.sent5: The mountain peak bared, offering a breathtaking view of the valley below.
